div.l: Aleyn welcome quod Symkin be my lif
Also Iohn · hou now what do ye hiere
Be god quod Iohn nede must ne hath no pere
Him behoues to serue him self that has no swain
Orellis he is a fooll as clerkes sain
Oure Manciple I hope he wol be ded
Swa werkes euer the wanges in his hed
And for thi I is ycom and eke Aleyn
To grinde oure corn and carie the mele agein
I pray you spede vs hen what that ye may
It shal be don quod Symkyn be my fay
What wol ye do whil it is in hande
Be god / riȝt be the hoper wol I stonde
Quod Iohn and se hou the corn gos In
Yit sauȝ I neuer be my fader kyn
Hou that the hoper wagges til and fra
Aleyn ansuerd Iohn wilt thou swa
Than wol I be benethe be my croune
And se hou that the mele falles doune
In til the trough that shal be my disport
For Iohn I may be of youre sort
I is as ille a Millere as ar ye
This Millere smileth at her nicete
And thouȝt al this nis but for a wile
They wene that noman may hem beguile
But be my thrift yet shal I blere here yhe
For al the sleiȝte of her Philosophie
The more queinte crekes that thei make
The more wol I stele whan I take
In stede of floure yit wol I yeue hem bren
The grettest clerkes ben nat wisest men

div.l: As whilom to the wolf thus spak the mare
Of al her art counte I nat a tare
Out at the dore he goth ful priueli
Whan that he saw his tyme softely
He loketh vp and doun til he had founde
The clerkes hors there it stood I bounde
Behinde the mille vnder a leuesell
And to the hors he goth him faire and wel
And strepeth of the bridell riȝt anon
And whan the hors was loos he ginneth gon̄
Toward the fen there wilde mares renne
